creator: scoenen@gmx.de
text:
Configuring web-apps within the server.xml file and setting the reloadable 
attribute to true works well within tomcat4 beta1, but since the beta2 version 
I cannot reproduce this behaviour. Changes to jsp files are not recognized as 
well. Instead, I have to manually delete the *.java and *.class files from 
tomcat's working directory to force a new compilation.

I have tested beta2, beta3 and beta4 and my applications do not reload. With 
beta 1 version everything works fine.

My deployment scenario is as follows:
Web-apps are registered within server.xml file and exist as directory trees (no 
war archives). The reloadable attribute is set to "true".

[I tried to use the manager application to reload my web-apps instead of using 
the automatic reloading feature, but this didn't work correctly for some web-
apps due to another bug that I have posted previously.]

Meanwhile I have downloaded Tomcat 4.0 beta 5 as was recommended.
I can confirm that automatic class reloading works well again for servlets and 
other classes.
However, when I make updates on JSP pages they are not automatically recompiled.
To summarize:
- class reloading now works with beta1 and beta 5 version.
- jsp recompilation works with beta1 only.
